means: 走得或动得不稳( totter的现在分词 )

sentence.Network_en: The baby began to crawl, then managed her first tottering steps.
sentence.Network_cn: 宝宝开始只是爬，后来第一次站起来蹒跚着走了几步。

sentence.Network_en: the tottering walls of the castle
sentence.Network_cn: 古城堡摇摇欲坠的墙壁

Hindu rule was already tottering before Muslim penetration ., 在伊斯兰教渗入之前 , 印度教的统治已经摇摇欲坠了.

entry.def: If someone totters somewhere, they walk there in an unsteady way, for example because they are ill or drunk.

example.ex: He tottered to the fridge, got a beer and slumped at the table...
example.tran: 他踉跄地走到冰箱前，拿出一瓶啤酒，一屁股坐在桌边。

example.ex: The baby began to crawl, then managed her first tottering steps.
example.tran: 宝宝开始只是爬，后来第一次站起来蹒跚着走了几步。

entry.tran: 摇摇欲坠;变得不稳;动摇
entry.def: If something such as a market or government is tottering, it is weak and likely to collapse or fail completely.

example.tran: 对濒临瓦解的政府的进一步批评

means.word_mean: 1. unsteady in gait as from infirmity or old age;
2. (of structures or institutions) having lost stability; failing or on the point of collapse;

auth_sentence.content: Whose delicatessen store was tottering on the brink of ruin.
auth_sentence.res_content: Whose delicatessen store was tottering on the brink of ruin.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Whose delicatessen store was tottering on the brink of ruin.

auth_sentence.content: I made a bold coup to regain my tottering prestige.
auth_sentence.res_content: I made a bold coup to regain my tottering prestige.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I made a bold coup to regain my tottering prestige.

auth_sentence.content: Now the games-captain was tottering if not already fallen from the pedestal.
auth_sentence.res_content: Now the games-captain was tottering if not already fallen from the pedestal.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Now the games-captain was tottering if not already fallen from the pedestal.
